intro: Radackia amicorum, commonly known as the friendship violet, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate forests of Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-blue flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-drained, loamy soil. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Radackia amicorum is considered endangered and is protected in several European countries.
